intro: Campanula ottoniana, commonly known as the Otto's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Campanula ottoniana is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
